Key Match Events: Zach LaVine returned to the Chicago Bulls lineup after a three-game absence due to an injury.
LaVine finished the game with 18 points, two rebounds, and seven assists.
The Bulls won the game 125-113 against the Hawks at the State Farm Arena in Atlanta.
Seven other Bulls players reached double figures, including Ayo Dosunmu with a team-high 19 points off the bench.
Nikola Vucevic and Coby White also scored 18 points each, while Josh Giddey had 13 points, six rebounds, and seven assists.
Post-Match Reflections: With their win on Saturday, the Chicago Bulls snapped a three-game skid to improve to 4-6 for the season.
The Bulls are back home for their next game on Monday against the Cleveland Cavaliers, who are the only perfect team in the NBA this season with a record of 11-0.
